verses.text: The sons of Judah ; Pharez , Hezron , and Carmi , and Hur , and Shobal.\f + \fr 4.1 \ft Carmi: also called, Chelubai or Caleb\f*
And Reaiah the son of Shobal begat Jahath ; and Jahath begat Ahumai , and Lahad. These \add are\add* the families of the Zorathites.\f + \fr 4.2 \ft Reaiah: or, Haroeh\f*
And these \add were of\add* the father of Etam ; Jezreel , and Ishma , and Idbash : and the name of their sister \add was\add* Hazelelponi :
And Penuel the father of Gedor , and Ezer the father of Hushah. These \add are\add* the sons of Hur , the firstborn of Ephratah , the father of Beth-lehem. \p
¶ And Ashur the father of Tekoa had two wives , Helah and Naarah.
And Naarah bare him Ahuzam , and Hepher , and Temeni , and Haahashtari. These \add were\add* the sons of Naarah.
And the sons of Helah \add were\add*, Zereth , and Jezoar , and Ethnan.
And Coz begat Anub , and Zobebah , and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum. \p
¶ And Jabez was more honourable than his brethren : and his mother called his name Jabez , saying , Because I bare him with sorrow.\f + \fr 4.9 \ft Jabez: that is, Sorrowful\f*

And Jabez called on the God of Israel , saying , Oh that thou wouldest bless me indeed , and enlarge my coast , and that thine hand might be with me, and that thou wouldest keep \add me\add* from evil , that it may not grieve me! And God granted him that which he requested.\f + \fr 4.10 \ft Oh…: Heb. If thou wilt, etc\f*\f + \fr 4.10 \ft keep…: Heb. do me\f* \p
¶ And Chelub the brother of Shuah begat Mehir , which \add was\add* the father of Eshton.
And Eshton begat Beth-rapha , and Paseah , and Tehinnah the father of Ir-nahash. These \add are\add* the men of Rechah.\f + \fr 4.12 \ft Ir-nahash: or, the city of Nahash\f*
And the sons of Kenaz ; Othniel , and Seraiah : and the sons of Othniel ; Hathath.\f + \fr 4.13 \ft Hathath…: or, Hathath, and Meonothai, who begat, etc\f*

And Meonothai begat Ophrah : and Seraiah begat Joab , the father of the valley of Charashim ; for they were craftsmen.\f + \fr 4.14 \ft valley: or, inhabitants of the valley\f*\f + \fr 4.14 \ft Charashim: that is, craftsmen\f*\f + \fr 4.14 \ft Hathath…: or, Hathath, and Meonothai, who begat, etc\f*
And the sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh ; Iru , Elah , and Naam : and the sons of Elah , even Kenaz.\f + \fr 4.15 \ft even Kenaz: or, Uknaz\f*
And the sons of Jehaleleel ; Ziph , and Ziphah , Tiria , and Asareel.
And the sons of Ezra \add were\add*, Jether , and Mered , and Epher , and Jalon : and she bare Miriam , and Shammai , and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.

And his wife Jehudijah bare Jered the father of Gedor , and Heber the father of Socho , and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. And these \add are\add* the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh , which Mered took.\f + \fr 4.18 \ft Jehudijah: or, the Jewess\f*
And the sons of \add his\add* wife Hodiah the sister of Naham , the father of Keilah the Garmite , and Eshtemoa the Maachathite.\f + \fr 4.19 \ft Hodiah: or, Jehudijah, mentioned before\f*
And the sons of Shimon \add were\add*, Amnon , and Rinnah , Ben-hanan , and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi \add were\add*, Zoheth , and Ben-zoheth. \p

¶ The sons of Shelah the son of Judah \add were\add*, Er the father of Lecah , and Laadah the father of Mareshah , and the families of the house of them that wrought fine linen , of the house of Ashbea ,
And Jokim , and the men of Chozeba , and Joash , and Saraph , who had the dominion in Moab , and Jashubi-lehem. And \add these are\add* ancient things.
These \add were\add* the potters , and those that dwelt among plants and hedges : there they dwelt with the king for his work. \p
¶ The sons of Simeon \add were\add*, Nemuel , and Jamin , Jarib , Zerah , \add and\add* Shaul :\f + \fr 4.24 \ft Nemuel: or, Jemuel\f*\f + \fr 4.24 \ft Jarib, Zerah: or, Jachin Zohar\f*
Shallum his son , Mibsam his son , Mishma his son.
And the sons of Mishma ; Hamuel his son , Zacchur his son , Shimei his son.
And Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters ; but his brethren had not many children , neither did all their family multiply , like to the children of Judah.\f + \fr 4.27 \ft like…: Heb. unto\f*
And they dwelt at Beer-sheba , and Moladah , and Hazar-shual ,
And at Bilhah , and at Ezem , and at Tolad ,\f + \fr 4.29 \ft Bilhah: or, Balah\f*\f + \fr 4.29 \ft Tolad: or, Eltolad\f*
And at Bethuel , and at Hormah , and at Ziklag ,
And at Beth-marcaboth , and Hazar-susim , and at Beth-birei , and at Shaaraim. These \add were\add* their cities unto the reign of David.\f + \fr 4.31 \ft Hazar-susim: or, Hazar-susah\f*
And their villages \add were\add*, Etam , and Ain , Rimmon , and Tochen , and Ashan , five cities :\f + \fr 4.32 \ft Etam: or, Ether\f*

And all their villages that \add were\add* round about the same cities , unto Baal. These \add were\add* their habitations , and their genealogy.\f + \fr 4.33 \ft Baal: or, Baalath-beer\f*\f + \fr 4.33 \ft their genealogy: or, as they divided themselves by nations among them\f*
And Meshobab , and Jamlech , and Joshah the son of Amaziah ,
And Joel , and Jehu the son of Josibiah , the son of Seraiah , the son of Asiel ,
And Elioenai , and Jaakobah , and Jeshohaiah , and Asaiah , and Adiel , and Jesimiel , and Benaiah ,
And Ziza the son of Shiphi , the son of Allon , the son of Jedaiah , the son of Shimri , the son of Shemaiah ;
These mentioned by \add their\add* names \add were\add* princes in their families : and the house of their fathers increased greatly.\f + \fr 4.38 \ft mentioned: Heb. coming\f* \p
¶ And they went to the entrance of Gedor , \add even\add* unto the east side of the valley , to seek pasture for their flocks.
And they found fat pasture and good , and the land \add was\add* wide , and quiet , and peaceable ; for \add they\add* of Ham had dwelt there of old.

And these written by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah , and smote their tents , and the habitations that were found there, and destroyed them utterly unto this day , and dwelt in their rooms: because \add there was\add* pasture there for their flocks.

And \add some\add* of them, \add even\add* of the sons of Simeon , five hundred men , went to mount Seir , having for their captains Pelatiah , and Neariah , and Rephaiah , and Uzziel , the sons of Ishi.
And they smote the rest of the Amalekites that were escaped , and dwelt there unto this day.
